Description: Round-topped limestone stela divided into four registers: 1 - Two jackals upon plinths. 2 + 3 - Scenes of five kneeling figures, the rightmost facing the others; two rows of Hieroglyphic text above. 4 - Seated male figure to the left before a table and standing figure, kneeling female figure with a pile of offerings to the right.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1912 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 3. (pl.15)
